ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: What is the matter with them that they run from the Reminder
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Why then do they turn away from the admonition
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: What is the matter with people that they are turning away from this Exhortation,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: If such will be the Day of Judgment, what is the matter with them? Why do they run away from guidance,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So what is the matter with them that they turn away from the advice?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then what is wrong with them that they turn away from admonition
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: What is then the matter with them, that they turn away from the admonition
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: What ails them, that they turn away from the Reminder,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Why now turn they away from the Admonishment,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Then what is wrong with them that they turn away from admonition,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: What aileth them, therefore, that they are from the Admonition turning away?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: What is the matter with them that they evade the Reminder
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then what is the matter with them that they turn away from admonition?-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then what is wrong with them (i.e. the disbelievers) that they turn away from (receiving) admonition?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: What is the matter with them that they turn away from this Reminder,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Why are they turning away from the Reminder?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then what is [the matter] with them that they are, from the reminder, turning away
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [74:49] So what (fa-mā: the subject) is wrong with them (lahum: the predicate thereof, semantically connected to an omitted clause, the person of which has been transposed onto it) that they turn away (mu‘ridīna is a circumstantial qualifier referring to the [suffixed] pronoun [in lahum, ‘them’]) from the Reminder — in other words, ‘what has happened to them that they have turned away from admonition’ —
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Why now turn they away from) disbelieve in (the Admonishment) the Qur'an
